poll_list.title: Governance Communications Core Unit (COM-001) Funding Request - December 12, 2022

content.content: GovComms Winddown Spending Permission  Context We’re in a unique situation. Govcomm’s current active budget expires on 12/31/22. With our last budget proposal, SP84, rejected, we are winding down the Core Unit and formally proposing its offboarding. As detailed in the offboarding proposal, there are some administrative tasks that need to be completed in the month of January. Unfortunately, we don’t have any spend approved past the new year and we don’t feel comfortable spending without some form of explicit approval from voters.  Our Ask We are asking governance to approve winddown spending that includes compensation for the facilitator during the month of January in addition to a few one-time expenses detailed in the offboarding proposal.  Facilitator Compensation for the month of January 2023. Service fees to AccountAble for the month of January 2023. Offboard fees to our payroll provider.  No transfer is necessary as we have excess funds available from our previous budget, just approval. This request will be going up as a governance poll on Monday, thank you GovAlpha! @Recognized-Delegates
content.GPT-summary: The post is a proposal from GovComms requesting approval for winddown spending that includes compensation for the facilitator during the month of January and a few one-time expenses. The proposal explains the situation and the need for explicit approval from voters. The post also mentions that the request will be going up as a governance poll on Monday and thanks GovAlpha.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Want to confirm on the Governance end that we’re going to list this as a poll on Monday. Essentially David is asking for permission to use funds he already has access to, but the funds have restrictions based on his budget MIP. This will be a weekly poll @Recognized-Delegates and other MKR voters, so please use this thread to ask questions or generate discussion ASAP.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Looking through the history of your Core Unit, we don’t believe you have returned any funds to the DAO since inception. While some believe your budget has been reasonable, Flip Flop Flap Delegate has a preference for you to return the funds to the DAO and show good faith. We believe this is a great gesture in showcasing good Core Unit behavior.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: With all due respect Frank, the return of excess funds is not up for question. I believe their return is a requirement, not a preference, for an ethical offboarding of any Core Unit. We did not return excess funds because the amounts carried have been within the new MIP40 requirement, thanks to our tight budgeting. We will be returning all excess funds at the close of our Core Unit.

Inline with StableNode’s stance, while we believe 1 month is short for successful transition, as the core unit is not yet offboarded and mandates still valid, we will vote in support.    Resource and Clarity for Core Units’ Transitions into Endgame   Therefore, for delegates and governance participants that believe funding requests and mandates are fair but the issue is with the structure, we encourage you to support needed funding and resources that such Core Units request to transition successfully.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: @Recognized-Delegates The Governance Poll is up  vote.makerdao.com   Governance Portal The MakerDAO Governance Portal allows for anyone to view governance proposals, and also allows for MKR holders to vote.

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
